ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: question 10: Professor William Vance , as a very skilled researcher in communication, really is the best compared with the teacher i met in China. I am go lucky to choose this class as a international student in my 1st semester here! Learned a lot refreshing point in my language study from William Vance !
The aasssognments where very annoying, I feel that I learnt little with em. For me they were more like a waste of time. I also felt that we were treated in a condescending way
I will finish in following boxes.
To question 1, I feel the PDF booklet is exceptionally helpful. I didn't see how much the required textbook prepared me for the lectures and practicums.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: structural, useful, and practical
Well organized.
The speaking intonation and pause between phrase is most most helpful to me. And as well how to read fast
All material learned was applicable in real life.
The coordination between lectures and practicum assignments.
This course help students to learn how to improve communication strategies not just speaking language itself.
1. The practicums. Especially feedback on individual responses. 2. Useful tips throughout the PDF booklet.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Would be better if the course can give more structural feedback to students.
Some exercise could be done again one or two weeks after the first round, so that students can remember it better.
I think all looks good to me , PERFECT!
Assignment

The course is great teaching American academic communication skills. However, global communications demands to be aware of cultural differences when communicating. It may be good to include some ideas about intercultural exchange.
It should have more credit hours.

I felt uncomfortable speaking to a computer for the final exam. I was very nervous when timed by the software to prepare and speak, even more so than giving a presentation in class. I was much less natural than talking to real people. Could we try face to face evaluation for the future?

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Yes, very effective.
Matched well ! Every Tuesday we practice what we learned in last week. We have time to digest during weekend.
It is very useful to have peer reviewed during the practicum, however, the time is very limited for everyone and is not enough.

The practicums were the gem of this course. Julie did a fantastic job! We often didn't have enough time to finish within 1 hour, and were rushing through activities. Could we consider extending the practicum to 1.5 hours, so that we have more time to ask questions and engage with the coach?

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: As a international student who just arrived Yale in the 1st semester to learn academic writing and speaking
The skills learned in this course has certainly helped me to improve my academic and professional performance.
This is a very useful class especially for international students.

As an international student, I'm constantly battling the fact that I can't speak and write as effectively and naturally as native speakers. I understand job opportunities won't differentiate whether applicants speak English as a foreign language, so this class was extremely valuable. It help me to begin communicating in a clear, logic, and concise manner. After coming to the U.S. for 5 years, this class was probably the last opportunity for me to systematically boost English language skills for free.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I want to improve my communication skill.
Required to take it, but with no regrets.
My soft skill improved a lot
1. it is a requirement for me. 2. I really want to improve my communication skills.
See my response to question 17.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes, but need practice by myself
Yes, even more than I expected.
Over my expectation
It has progresses but not enough since practices are not enough and this is a long term study.
Yes, but not quite. I got what I should do from the class, but I will need more time to practice in the future.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: We , 5 members, participated practicum group and became friends after all. We shared information and learning skills
Small working groups gave us a chance to participate more actively.
NA

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: go and take it, be active in the course
Great choice to take, I have recommended a lot of students to take from SOM, but unfortunately there is no this class in Sprint semester

The class itself is interesting in a way in which it gives you interesting tools for communicating; however, it requires effort, way beyond the class, to actively use them in your regular life and it might prove challenging specially because of cultural or language barriers.
Do all the outside-class assignments.
Do the home exercises.
Take this class and you will not regret.

Complete all the readings--the booklet is very well written and helpful. Follow assignment instructions and take time to do the daily exercises, so that we can be well prepared for and get the most out of practicum sessions.
